EXIT   X

HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK

Page

Table of Contents

 

Step in the right direction

 

A Safe Work Australia report revealed that in 2013, Australian workplaces recorded the lowest number of fatalities in 11 years. Although 191 workers died from workplace-related injuries, this was a 16 per cent decrease from the 2012 figure. However, the fatality rate for self-employed workers was three times higher than the fatality rate for employees.

 

The implementation of good practices helps to:

 

•

prevent injuries and promote workplace safety

•

reduce employee absenteeism and levels of sick leave

•

reduce workers' compensation costs

•

increase staff morale, lead to greater productivity and improve product quality

You should ensure you have a good understanding of WHS policies and procedures by:

 

Click on the icons below for more information

 

 

 

 

 

making sure you have a copy of your employer's WHS policies and procedures

 

regularly reading the policies and procedures that apply to your work

 

following the policies and procedures

 

speaking to your employer about any changes that you think should be made

Step in the right direction
